column1: Data Supplied By: National Livestock Reporting Service
Data source: National Livestock Reporting Service
Please see terms of use here: https://www.mla.com.au/general/Terms-and-conditions/data-and-information/

There was a much smaller yarding of 68 trade and export cattle at Powranna on Tuesday with some very good quality yearlings included. Trade cattle sold to good competition with yearling steers making 344c to 372c, leaner 292c to 300c and the few heifers 310c to 334c.
The few grown steers made 320c to 358c while heavy beef cows made 268c to 302c to average 6c higher. Medium weight cows made 250c to 272c and lighter D1 cows 118c to 180c/kg live.

Market Reporter Richard Bailey
